issues.summary: PMAN: AP: Prepare script(s) to enable Purchasing Organization feature toggle for all customers
issues.description: Goal: Prepare script(s) to enable the Purchasing Organization feature toggle for all customers. Acceptance Criteria: Prepare a dynamic script that will enable the new Purchasing Organization feature toggle for all customers (unitIds) that are configured in a given environment. This script is expected to be executed in the following environments: DEVQA environments, SOCI, PERF, and Production. Only customers that have  PURCHASE__COMPANY_ACCOUNTING_LINE_ITEM_CONFIGURATION  enabled are able to see the Purchasing Organization on the invoice and memo user interfaces. If a customer does  not  have  PURCHASE__COMPANY_ACCOUNTING_LINE_ITEM_CONFIGURATION   enabled, then their users are unable to see the Purchasing Organization on the invoice and memo user interfaces, even if the new Purchasing Organization feature toggle is enabled for them. Backlog Grooming (December 6/7, 2023): Attendees:  Jaro, Mavin, Ahmed, Aqsa, Deepak Points of Discussion: Discussed the overall scope of the ticket. We collectively aligned that we’ll generate a dynamic script that will activate the feature for all customers, even if their unitId is inactive.

issues.summary: PMAN: AP: System includes Purchasing Organization in the CSV Posting files
issues.description: User Story: As an AP user , I want the Purchasing Organization to be included in the CSV posting file  so that  it can be integrated with my external system which is the source of truth. Acceptance Criteria: 1.  What is the change?  The system includes the Purchasing Organization field in the CSV posting files. 2.  Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true. Note:  For those customers who process memos, ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true. 3.  What pages should this change impact?  None – the change impacts both invoice and memo posting files. Note:  This change does not apply to auto memos. 4.  Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who are able to post AP documents. 5.  How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites:   Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The CSV connector is enabled by the Admin. A document is in an   or   status, ready to be posted out of the system. Document Posting When a user or system posts a single/multiple documents, the system includes the Purchasing Organization in the posting file. The system showcases two fields for each document line item, as listed below. The positioning of these fields are  dynamic  based on the current implementation, that is, they can be positioned anywhere in the file (using the script). Purchasing Organization Code Purchasing Organization Description Note to QA:  Please ensure to test the dynamic positioning of the fields listed above, that is, verify if the Purchasing Organization fields can be positioned at any location in the file. The system displays the values as-is. The system leaves the fields above as empty/null if no Purchasing Organization is defined. 6.  Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Yes. A data script will be required to position the two Purchasing Organization fields at the far right of the posting file  for existing customers who will have CSV connector on at the time of executing the script in the respective environment . The data script may need to be executed in DEVQA, SOCI, PERR, and Production environments. 7.  Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes, after the change is deployed in Production. Existing documents being posted will have Purchasing Organization in the CSV posting file but it will be blank/null. 8.  To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date 1 5 Deepak December 6, 2023 Ahmed December 6, 2023 2 5 Deepak December 6, 2023 December 6, 2023 # Question Recommendation Response Remarks 1 Is the CSV file static or dynamic? None. Dynamic, based on  's examination of the code. 2 Is any Purchasing Organization attribute different from any of the other Organization or Accounting elements? None. No. Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan 1 Where should we place the Purchasing Organization in the CSV posting files? Not applicable. The posting file is dynamic, meaning that the fields can be positioned anywhere. 2 Should we consider if the Purchasing Organization is enabled or not, or if the new feature toggle is enabled? No. Purchasing Organization will be available to be displayed in the CSV posting files irrespective of feature toggles or settings. Unnecessary complication and it will have no affect if Purchasing Organization info is present in the file. If no value is present, the value will be blank. 3 Do we need to massage or localize the values prior to displaying the file? Do we need to consider the leading zeroes setting? No. We don’t currently take the leading zeroes into account for any posting mechanism. Backlog Grooming (December 6, 2023): Attendees:  Jaro, Mavin, Ahmed, Aqsa, Deepak Points of Discussion: Discussed the ticket overall. Assigned action items to Ahmed to: Understand if the CSV file is static or dynamic. Talk to Imran regarding leading zeroes and examine the code base. Sprint Planning (December 7, 2023): Attendees:  Jaro, Ahmed, Aqsa, Sujoy, Deepak Points of Discussion: Reviewed Ahmed’s findings. Made decisions on the decision points above. Sized the ticket in SP.

issues.summary: PMAN: AP: AP Users are able to update Purchasing Organization in APPROVED status and beyond
issues.description: User Story: As an AP user , I want to be able to correct the coding information when a document is in an approved state or beyond  so that  I can ensure accuracy of the Purchasing Organization information on the document. Acceptance Criteria: 1.  What is the change?  The system allows AP users to edit the Purchasing Organization information on a document in   status and greater. 2.  Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true  and  the Purchasing Organization feature toggle = true. Note:  For those customers who process memos, ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true. 3.  What pages should this change impact?  Invoices and memos. Note:  This change does not apply to auto memos. 4.  Which users should be impacted by the change?  The following users will be able to update the Purchasing Organization in the statuses listed below: Document owners (AP Processor/Manager), individual or part of a group. All AP Managers. 5.  How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites:   Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The Purchasing Organization setting in Documents → Settings → All Documents is configured to one of Optional  or  Required. A document is in one of the following statuses  and  editing has been enabled in the respective status: APPROVED READY TO POST POSTING FAILED POSTED PARTIALLY PAID PAID Document Update Users are able to click on the pencil icon → navigate to edit mode → edit the Purchasing Organization one line item at a time by clicking on the pencil icon or using the Apply All modal. Audit Trail The system instantly captures changes performed by a user to the Purchasing Organization on all the document line items (in the above statuses) in the “<Document> Updated“ audit log. Purchasing Organization = Required ,  , and   Status Actions / Transitions When the system showcases the Purchasing Organization is missing error, the system instantly showcases the “Select Next Action“ option which when clicked showcases the “Return to Draft“ and “Assign“ transitions; the “Finalize Update(s)“ transition is  not  available. ,  , and   Status Actions / Transitions When the system showcases the Purchasing Organization is missing error, the system instantly showcases the “Return to Draft“ transition only; the “Finalize Update(s)“ transition is  not  available. Note:  The implementation of the Purchasing Organization field, e.g. filtering (what values are showcased, etc.), validations, etc., will be the same as described in  . 6.  Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. 7.  Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes. 8.  To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Test Data: Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date # Question Recommendation Response Remarks Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan 1 Should we grant any other user the ability to edit a document in the above listed statuses? No. Anyone who is able to edit a document in the above statuses should continue to do so. 2 Should we split the ticket for invoices and memos? No. The scope is manageable. 3 How should the system tackle  existing documents in the above statuses? Read only:  No validation will be done in these statuses, except   . Edit mode:  They will reflect the latest state of the Purchasing Organization settings, in terms of line item display (and pertinent changes, e.g. error messages). The assumption is that customers will want any new document and existing documents in process to reflect the latest changes. Backlog Grooming (December 5/6, 2023): Attendees:  Jaro, Mavin, Ahmed, Asma, Aqsa, Sujoy, Deepak Points of Discussion: Discussed the ticket as a whole, including the decision points. Backlog Grooming (December 6, 2023): Attendees:  Jaro, Mavin, Ahmed, Jimena, Asma, Aqsa, Deepak Points of Discussion: Discussed the ticket as a whole, including the decision points. Sized the ticket in SP.

issues.summary: PMAN: AP: AP Approvers are able to update Purchasing Organization while document is pending approval
issues.description: User Story: As an AP Approver , I want to be able to correct the coding information when a document is assigned to me  so that  I can ensure accuracy of the Purchasing Organization information on the document. Acceptance Criteria: 1.  What is the change?  The system allows AP Approvers to code/edit the Purchasing Organization information on a document when it is assigned to them in   status. 2.  Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true  and  the Purchasing Organization feature toggle = true. Note:  For those customers who process memos, ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true. 3.  What pages should this change impact?  Invoices and memos. Note:  This change does not apply to auto memos. 4.  Which users should be impacted by the change?   AP Approvers (assigned to the document in   status) who have editing and/or coding privileges. All AP Managers. Note:  Only AP Approvers with editing and/or coding privileges can edit and/or code the Purchasing Organization information in   status, respectively. 5.  How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites:   Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The Purchasing Organization setting in Documents → Settings → All Documents is configured to one of Optional  or  Required. A document is assigned to an AP Approver in   status. AP Approver with Editing and/or Coding privileges If AP Approver has editing privileges | Any AP Manager Users are able to click on the pencil icon → navigate to edit mode → edit the Purchasing Organization one line item at a time by clicking on the pencil icon or using the Apply All modal. If AP Approver has coding privileges and does not have editing privileges Users are able to click on the calculator icon on the top right → navigate to coding mode → code the Purchasing Organization one line item at a time by clicking on the calculator icon or using the Apply All modal Approve and Reject (If Purchasing Organization = Required only) If document has  no  Purchasing Organization is missing error (and no other error) The user is able to  Approve  or  Reject  the document, both from a read only and edit modes. Note:  The system will showcase an error if the Purchasing Organization is  not  populated (when it is a required field). If document contains one or more Purchasing Organization is missing error (or other errors) The user is only able to  Reject  the document, both from a read only and edit modes. Note:  The implementation of the Purchasing Organization field, e.g. filtering (what values are showcased, etc.), validations, etc. will be the same as described in  . Document after being Approved/Rejected Audit Trail The system captures changes performed by a AP Approver in   status, to the Purchasing Organization on all the document line items, when the user executes the following actions: Reject (<Document> Rejected) Approve (<Document> Approved) Approve and Forward  or  Approve and forward to next AP Approver in the approval chain (<Document> Approved and forwarded to <next AP Approver>) AP Approver with no Editing or Coding privileges Users are unable to code or edit the Purchasing Organization on the entire document. 6.  Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  TBD. 7.  Would this change impact existing documents?  TBD. 8.  To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Test Data: Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date 1 5 Deepak December 1, 2023 December 4, 2023 1 5 Deepak December 1, 2023 December 4, 2023 # Question Recommendation Response Remarks 1 Unrelated to the ticket:  Can we retrieve a list of customers with Purchasing Organization optional vs required vs hidden? None. Yes – see comments below. 2 How does the user experience when an AP Approver has code and/or edit privileges? None. Code option (calculator) is displayed instead of edit (pencil) icon in the top right. Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan 1 Should AP Managers be able to edit/code Purchasing Organization in   status? Can they edit/code documents in   status currently? Yes. This is already supported currently. 2 How will existing documents in   status be handled? They will reflect the latest state of the Purchasing Organization settings, in terms of line item display (and pertinent changes, e.g. error messages). The assumption is that customers will want any new document and existing documents in process to reflect the latest changes. 3 Not related to this ticket:  Shall we remove the feature toggle implementation so that it doesn’t need to be considered for this change? No. Unknown unknowns. Let’s observe how the rollout works and then deprecate the feature toggle later. Support issues received or feedback received from customers. Backlog Grooming (December 4/5, 2023): Attendees:  Jaro, Mavin, Ahmed, Aqsa, Asma, Sujoy, Deepak Points of Discussion: Discussed the overall scope of the ticket. Reviewed the decision points and questions. Backlog Grooming (December 4/5, 2023): Attendees:  Jaro, Mavin, Ahmed, Aqsa, Asma, Sujoy, Deepak Points of Discussion: Reviewed the decision points again and made final decisions as documented above. Sized the ticket in SP.

issues.summary: Stage - Accounts Payable - AP Inbox - Error in Console upon Clicking to Create Invoice on the Popup against a Multi Page OCR Document.
issues.description: Environment: https://devqa5-go.vroozi.com Username :  asma.latif+AP2@vroozi.com Password:  Blueangel1@/ Blueangel1! Pre-Requisites: AP User should have logged into the Application. A Multipage PDF email should have been sent at the hopper address.   Steps to Reproduce: Access Inbox>Document Inbox. Click the Ellipses Icon against the newly arrived document in the Document Inbox Grid. Click to Either Create Invoice/Create Memo. A pop up appears. Ensure “All Pages” option selected and click to Create Invoice button. Pease see the error in Console. Invoice Screen shows after sometime but the popup remains processing on the screen. Access Archive Inbox. Repeat the aforementioned steps for the multipage document. Please see two errors in Console. issues.summary: Allow presets to be defined/managed using the the Budgets field on the new Apply to All modal
issues.description: Business Case: The objective is to update the "Manage Presets" tab on the Apply to All modal to incorporate the Budgets field, ensuring it adheres to the same rules and patterns as on the main tab. This tab allows users to define and save combinations of values (using the same fields as on the main tab) with a unique name. These presets can then be used to auto-populate fields on the main tab. Specifics for the Manage Presets Tab: The Budgets field needs to be integrated following the same visibility and optional status rules as in the main Apply to All modal. Users should be able to define combinations of values including the Budgets field and other parent elements (Company Code, Purchasing Organization, Plant, Cost Center, GL Code). The system should allow these combinations to be saved with unique names. Presets should be recallable for auto-populating fields on the main tab. Acceptance Criteria: Integrate the Budgets field on the Manage Presets tab, ensuring it behaves consistently with its implementation on the main Apply to All modal. Enable users to create and save presets that include combinations of Budgets and its parent elements. Ensure each preset can be named uniquely and saved within the system. Allow these presets to be easily recalled and used to auto-populate fields on the main Apply to All modal. Verify that the implementation aligns with the visibility rules and behaviour of the Budgets field as specified for the main tab in

issues.summary: Fix issues with the Budgets field on the new Apply to All modal
issues.description: Business Case: The goal is to modify the behavior of the Budgets field on the Apply to All modal. This field is conditionally visible based on whether the Budgets functionality is enabled for the user's unitID. Once enabled, the Budgets field should always be visible on the Apply to All modal and be optional by default. Specific Use Cases: Changing Only the Budget : When a user selects a budget for the line items using the Apply to All modal, the system should display all active, non-deleted budgets from the user's company account. The user can search and select a budget without being required to fill other fields. The system should then evaluate if the selected budget matches the existing company and accounting info on the item. If it matches, the change is applied; if not, a warning message (as per   ) is shown. Changing Parent Elements of Budgets : If any parent element (Company Code, Purchasing Organization, Plant, Cost Center, GL Code) is altered, all these fields, including the Budget field, become mandatory. The system should then provide a list of budgets based on the combination of these parent elements. The user's specified combination is applied to all selected items without further validation, as the modal already ensures a valid combination. Acceptance Criteria: Modify the Budgets field visibility to always appear when the Budgets functionality is enabled. Ensure the Budgets field is optional by default. Implement a functionality to display all active, non-deleted budgets for selection. Enable a search feature within the budget selection list. Allow the application of a selected budget to all chosen items, with system validation against existing item data. In the case of only Budget being changed, display a warning message if the selected budget doesn't match the item's existing data, using the pattern specified in   . Ignore these original requirements.  Make Budget and its parent elements (Company Code, Purchasing Organization, Plant, Cost Center, GL Code) mandatory if any one of the parent elements is altered. When parent elements are also specified, provide a filtered list of budgets based on the combination of the parent elements specified by the user. Ensure the system applies the combination of changes to all selected items without additional validation in the case of parent element modification. The updated requirements; following the team’s discussion and review of the existing Budgets implementation on 01/22/2024, are documented below.  In the case of any one of the parent elements ( which includes Company Code, Purchasing Org, Plant, Cost Center, GL Code ) of the Budget field being modified by the user, the Budget field should automatically become required on the Apply to All modal. This will ensure that the Apply to All modal will always send a combination of the parent element, and a Budget to be applied to the selected line items.  The system should evaluate the user’s specified value for the parent element, against the company info + accounting info already present on the selected line items, one at a time. If the user’s specified value can be used with the data already present on a given line item, the system should update that field in said line item, with the user’s specified change. if it can’t be used, then the system should leave the line item as it is and display a warning message using the pattern specified in   . Once the parent element has been updated, the system should then evaluate the user’s specified value for the Budget field, against the data present on the line item. If it can be applied to the line item, then the system should update the Budget in the line item. Otherwise, the system should leave the Budget field blank on the line item, and show the user the standard “ Budget missing ” error message at the document level.  Additional information regarding the scope of work being covered in this ticket, as determined after discussion with QA: Purchase team will work off of the assumption, that the BE logic currently in the system; as of 01/22/2024, to fetch Budgets that can be used on a given line item, is working correctly. If there are any issues with that particular service’s behavior, it will be referred to and addressed by the Budget team.  Example scenario to clarify the above statement: If the user updates the values in the GL Code and Budget fields on the Apply to All modal; say he selects  GL1  and  BudgetABC , respectively.  The system will 1st evaluate  GL1  against the given Company Code data on the selected line item.  Assuming that  GL1  can be used with the given company code, the system will update the value of the GL Code field in the line item to  GL1 .  Next, the system will use the existing Budget fetching logic to get all active budgets that can be used with the combination of Company Code, Purchasing Org, Plant, Cost Center and GL Code on the line item. If the user’s specified Budget;  BudgetABC , is included in that list, the system will update the Budget field’s value on the line item to  BudgetABC . Alternatively, if  BudgetABC  isn’t part of that list returned by the system, then the budget field on the line item will be reset to empty, and the standard “ Budget missing ” error message will be displayed for that line item, at the document level.

issues.summary: Compile an Inventory of Areas Potentially Affected by Third-Party Cookies Phaseout - Phase I
issues.description: Goal Identify all areas in PMAN + SmartOCI that might be impacted due to Third-Party Cookies Phaseout Context Google Chrome has announced plans to begin disabling third-party cookies for 1% of users starting in the first quarter of 2024. This action is intended for testing purposes, with the process gradually scaling up to 100% of users, probably starting sometime in Q3 2024. Source:    Browsers such as Firefox and Safari have already phased out third-party cookies. Microsoft Edge, which is based on the Chromium engine, has not yet announced any changes, and for now, third-party cookies are allowed by default. It is crucial to ensure that Vroozi customers are not significantly impacted by these planned changes. Therefore, we need to identify all areas that might be affected by the disabling of third-party cookies. Note Adab mentioned that it has been reported that customers have already complained about Looker not working in Firefox and Safari -   . Tasks Compile the inventory of potential issues introduced by Third-Party cookies in the following Google Sheet:    Identify all potential issues along with the customers who might be impacted Ensure that we have testing steps to reproduce the functionality Audit cookies while executing testing steps (refer to:  https://developers.google.com/privacy-sandbox/3pcd#audit ) Test for breakage (refer to:  https://developers.google.com/privacy-sandbox/3pcd#test ). This is to simulate the state after the phase-out. Note: If we are unable to execute the audit or the test for breakage, we should ask the client to perform the test on our behalf. If the functionality will stop working, we need to prioritize the issue based on customer usage and the complexity of the solution Inventory sheet :

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin can change the status of the accounting string through bulk upload
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to change the status of the accounting string(s) through bulk upload. Acceptance Criteria: The following red highlighted portion is not required at this point. Updated on    Admin should provide 'X' or any value in the  Deactivate  column of the downloaded accounting string bulk upload template if they want to deactivate an accounting string. If the current status of the accounting string is inactive and the user tries to deactivate the accounting string, the system should mention that in the error report. The message should be “the accounting string <strigName> is already inactive.“ If the user leaves the  Deactivate  column empty, nothing should happen. Status  (optional input column in upload accounting string file) The user should be able to provide: Active(for activating an accounting string) Inactive(for deactivating an accounting string) If a user leaves the Status field empty, nothing should happen to the existing status of the accounting string. While creating a new accounting string via bulk upload, any  Duration ( valid from, valid to ) or  Status  should be given. If both are missing, the default status should be  Active . ( Updated on  ) If both are given, the system should check the  Duration ( valid from, valid to ) and decide whether to consider the status field. ( Following are the scenarios when the system should not consider the Status field ) If the  Valid From  date is not given, the system should consider the value given in the  Status  field. If the  Valid From  date is given with a future date, the system should ignore the  Status  field if the  Active  value is given.  If only  Status  is given, the system should assign the given status to the accounting string. Please note that above AC should be working for both Creating or updating accounting strings via Bulk UPload

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Additional columns in downloaded template and exported accounting strings
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to see the  Status ,  Deactivate , and  Deleted  columns in the Downloaded template and exported accounting strings. Acceptance Criteria: Download Template: If the admin downloads the template, it should contain the following additional columns as well in the template file: (in template download, no values should be there) Status  (informational in download template and export accounting strings)( Updated on  ) It is for the current status of the accounting string. This column is just informational in the download template and export accounting strings.  In upload, this column will become an optional status change field(as discussed in  ) Deactivate  (optional, flag) ( The red highlighted portion is not required at this point. Updated on     ) This is the action column. Users can provide' X' If they want to deactivate an accounting string.  Delete  (optional, flag) ( Updated on  ) This is the action column. Users can provide' X' If they want to deactivate an accounting string.  Here is the updated template Export Accounting Strings: If the admin exports the accounting strings, it should contain the following additional columns as well in the exported file Status  (informational) It will contain the current status of the accounting string. This column is just informational.  The user is not required to provide any value in that. Deactivate  (optional, flag) ( The red highlighted portion is not required at this point. Updated on     ) There should be no value in this column of the exported file. This is the action column. Users can provide' X' If they want to deactivate an accounting string.  Delete  (optional, flag)( Updated on  ) There should be no value in this column of the exported file. This is the action column. Users can provide' X' If they want to deactivate an accounting string.

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin can download the bulk upload error report
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to see the error report if there are any issues in the Accounting String Bulk Upload file. Acceptance Criteria: If there are any type of errors in the bulk upload file or processing failure, the system should show a red exclamation: Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Download Error Report . Clicking on the   Download Error Report  icon should download the error report.  The system identifies the errors after processing the file: If there are invalid records in the columns of the accounting string bulk upload file, the system should mention them in the error report as per the existing standard of bulk upload error report. Please refer to the following pattern. Row# of the file. Issue(s) that causes the error. If there are multiple errors for a single row, all errors should be visible with comma separated. ( Not Required. Updated on  ) If there are multiple errors for a single row, all errors should be visible in a separate row. ( Added on    ) The Processing Failure: The system supports bulk upload file in XLSX format If the user tries to upload the file in a format the system does not support, there should be a processing failure report. The error report in the PDF should say “Invalid file format. Kindly download the template and use that file format for bulk upload.“ If the user removes any required column from the bulk upload file or provides an invalid column name, the system should provide those details in the PDF error report. Each error should be accommodated in a separate row in case of multiple errors.

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin can download the existing accounting strings master data
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to download the existing accounting strings in Vroozi master data. Acceptance Criteria: There should be an  Export Accounting Strings  icon above the top right corner of the accounting string table on the Accounting String screen. ( The following image is just for reference. ) Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Export Accounting Strings . It should be dependent on a sub-feature toggle for UI CRUD operations(refer to  ). If the above-mentioned feature toggle is ON, the user should be able to see the  Export Accounting Strings  icon. If the above-mentioned feature toggle is OFF, the user should not be able to see the  Export Accounting Strings  icon. Clicking on the  Export Accounting Strings  icon should download the template in the xlsx format. When the user clicks on the  Export Accounting Strings  icon, the system should show the following overlay that should disappear automatically: The In Progress spinner should appear around the  Export Accounting Strings  icon: Once the file is processed, The following overlay should appear that should disappear automatically: The  Export Accounting Strings  icon should turn green:  Clicking on the green  Export Accounting Strings  icon should download the accounting strings file. The name of the downloaded file should be  Accounting-Strings-Export-{dateTimeStamp}.

issues.summary: AccVal: Admin: Admin can  upload the accounting strings via bulk upload file
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to be able to upload the accounting strings via bulk upload file. So the system can use them for document validation. Acceptance Criteria: There should be a  Upload Accounting Strings  icon above the top right corner of the accounting string table on the Accounting String screen. ( The following image is just for reference. ) It should be dependent on a sub-feature toggle for UI CRUD operations(refer to  ). If the above-mentioned feature toggle is ON, the user should be able to see the  Upload Accounting Strings  icon. If the above-mentioned feature toggle is OFF, the user should not be able to see the  Upload Accounting Strings  icon. Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Upload Accounting Strings . Clicking on the  Upload Accounting Strings  icon should open a window where users can select and upload the bulk upload file. Upon Selecting the file, the system should validate the bulk upload file to verify all the data is valid. In case of valid data in the bulk upload file, the system should save the accounting strings uploaded via bulk upload in the DB. There should be a green noty message stating that the file has been uploaded successfully. They should start appearing in the accounting string table. If there are errors in the files, the system should generate an error report which the user can download. (refer to the ticket   ). There should a red noty message stating that the file has been failed to upload or there are errors in the file. Here is the attached template file that should be used for the accounting string bulk upload. There is one optional column  DELETED  in the bulk upload file. It is a flag type(true or false). The user can use it to delete the existing record in the system through bulk upload. The user can provide  X or any letter  in the column to mark the  DELETED  flag true. The accounting string with the  DELETED  flag true should be soft-deleted and kept in the DB. issues.summary: Add support for Split Accounting to the updated Apply to All modal
issues.description: This ticket MUST be released along with:    This ticket will NOT have any effect on how the “Apply to All” functionality works on the following documents: Payment Request Invoice Memo Expense Business Case: Following the updates done in   and    , a key element is missing: the ability to apply split accounting assignments to selected line items. This enhancement aims to provide users with the ability to assign accounting splits based on quantity, value, or percent using the new Apply to All modal. We also want to enabled users to define presets with split accounting from the “Manage Presets” tab, and then use them from the “Changes to be Applied” tab.  Acceptance Criteria: Note: The behavior described in this ticket MUST work consistently on all line items, regardless of how they were added to the document: Manually via the “ Add Item ” function Shopping Cart Bulk Upload template UI Enhancement: A new field labeled "Split Account Assignment" should be added to the Accounting section of the Apply to All modal. The new field should have the following options: <blank>, "None", "By Quantity", "By Value", "By Percent", with <blank> as the default. Functionality for <Blank>: By default, the <blank> option should be selected.  Selecting this option should maintain the current UI state. Upon application, the system should NOT make any changes to the split accounting status of the selected items.  Instead, any fields which have values specified in them, should be updated across all the available accounting segments of all the selected line items.  Functionality for 'None': Selecting "None" should maintain the current UI state. Upon application, the system should overwrite existing split accounting segments with the new data provided, making all fields in the Accounting section required. Functionality for 'By Quantity': Selecting "By Quantity" should dynamically add at least two sets of accounting fields. Users should be able to add additional sets of identical fields. A required field labeled "Quantity #1", "Quantity #2", etc., should be added to each set. Upon application, the system should overwrite existing split accounting segments with the new data provided, making all fields in the Accounting section required. Functionality for 'By Value': Selecting "By Value" should replicate the functionality of "By Quantity", replacing "Quantity #n" with "Value #n" fields. Functionality for 'By Percent': Selecting "By Percent" should replicate the functionality of "By Quantity", replacing "Quantity #n" with "Percent #n" fields. Application of Changes: The system should evaluate if the user's specified changes are compatible with each pre-selected line item. Compatibility for split accounting by quantity will be determined by comparing the sum of the quantities specified by the user, across all accounting segments, to the total order quantity of the selected line item. If the two values are equal, then the change can be applied, otherwise, the item must not be updated. Compatibility for split accounting by value will be determined by comparing the sum of the values specified by the user, across all accounting segments, to the total order value of the selected line item. If the two values are equal, then the change can be applied, otherwise, the item must not be updated. Compatibility for split accounting by percent will be determined by comparing the sum of the percentages specified by the user, across all accounting segments. if this sum adds up to “ 100 ”, then the change can be applied, otherwise, the item must not be updated.  Error Notification: If any of the user’s selected items were not updated, and the reason for that was related to the split accounting that the user was trying to apply. The system should display a persistent notification on the UI, informing the user about which items were not updated and providing a clear explanation of why they were not updated. This message should be displayed on screen using the pattern for document level warning messages; within the “ yellow ” panel.  If the user was trying to apply split accounting by quantity, this message should highlight the items that weren’t updated using the text “ < 1 > # < 2 > not updated. The sum of the quantities across all the accounting segments you specified, did not match the order quantity of < 3 >. “ < 1 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “ Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ Items “. < 2 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should only display the index number of that item and follow that with the word “ was ”. If there are multiple consecutive items in the list, the system use the pattern  [index number of the 1st item in the list] - [index number of the last item in the list]  and follow that with the word  “were“ . If there are multiple items in the list, but they’re not consecutive, the system should list the index numbers of all those items separated by commas, with the last item in that list being separated by an “ and ”. The end of the list should be followed by the word  “were“ .  < 3 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “ this Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ these Items “. If the user was trying to apply split accounting by value, this message should highlight the items that weren’t updated using the text “ < 1 > # < 2 > not updated. The sum of the values across all the accounting segments you specified, did not match the order value of  < 3 >. “ < 1 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “ Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ Items “. < 2 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should only display the index number of that item and follow that with the word “ was ”. If there are multiple consecutive items in the list, the system use the pattern  [index number of the 1st item in the list] - [index number of the last item in the list]  and follow that with the word  “were“ . If there are multiple items in the list, but they’re not consecutive, the system should list the index numbers of all those items separated by commas, with the last item in that list being separated by an “ and ”. The end of the list should be followed by the word  “were“ .  < 3 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “ this Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ these Items “. If the user was trying to apply split accounting by percent, this message should highlight the items that weren’t updated using the text “ < 1 > # < 2 > not updated. The sum of the percentages across all the accounting segments you specified, does not add up to 100%. “ < 1 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “ Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ Items “. < 2 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should only display the index number of that item and follow that with the word “ was ”. If there are multiple consecutive items in the list, the system use the pattern  [index number of the 1st item in the list] - [index number of the last item in the list]  and follow that with the word  “were“ . If there are multiple items in the list, but they’re not consecutive, the system should list the index numbers of all those items separated by commas, with the last item in that list being separated by an “ and ”. The end of the list should be followed by the word  “were“ .

issues.summary: Update the behavior of the Manage Presets tab, on the Apply to All modal across all Vroozi documents
issues.description: This ticket MUST be released along with    This ticket will NOT have any effect on how the “Apply to All” functionality works on the following documents: Payment Request Invoice Memo Expense Business Case: The behavior for the “*Apply to All*” modal needs to be updated across the application. So that users are able to change the value in as few as 1 individual field in the line items, using this mechanism. Additionally, Our system does not; currently, natively support many-to-many relationships between company info & accounting info master data objects. Many customers have worked around this limitation by creating duplicate accounting elements, each of which is connected to a different parent element. We somehow have to keep this " workaround " functioning. Acceptance Criteria: Note: The behavior described in this ticket MUST work consistently on all line items, regardless of how they were added to the document: Manually via the “*Add Item*” function Shopping Cart Bulk Upload template Apply to All Functionality: There should be a "Apply to All" button in the application's user interface. This button should NOT be visible to any Employee user that has coding restrictions enabled in their user record.   The user can select one or more items before clicking the "Apply to All" button. Clicking the "Apply to All" button should open a modal dialog containing a dynamic form with multiple input fields. This modal should only show fields for the Org / Accounting elements that are enabled in the unitID.  By default, all input fields in the modal should be blank. All input fields in the modal should be optional for the user to fill in. The system should only allow a user to set values in these fields that are currently “_not deleted_” and active in the unitID.  Parent-Child Relationship: Some fields in the modal are considered parent elements, and others are considered child elements. If a user fills in a parent field, the system should restrict the user to selecting values in the child fields that are linked to the selected value in the parent field. This filtering mechanism must be driven off of the parent-child relationship of these elements in the unitID’s master data If a parent field has only one possible value for a child field, that value should be automatically filled in by the system. Mandatory Child Fields: If the user fills in a parent field, the system must make it mandatory for the user to fill in all linked child fields before allowing the changes to be applied to the selected items. Validation and Notification: Note: The requirements documented below mean that either the user’s entire set of specified changes will be applied to the line item, or nothing will be updated. There will not be a scenario where the user specifies changes to “ n ” child fields, but the system only updates some fraction of those “ n ” fields; as they were the only ones that would be valid with the existing parent field values on the line item. In this scenario, the entire set of specified changes will be discarded, and the user will be shown the appropriate error message. If the user is only updating child fields, the system should allow the user to apply changes. During the application of changes, the system must evaluate each selected item to determine if the user's specified change can work with the values already provided in the selected item's parent fields. If a user's specified change is incompatible with the existing parent field values, that item should remain unchanged. The system should display a persistent notification on the UI, informing the user about which items were not updated and providing a clear explanation of why they were not updated. This message should be displayed on screen using the pattern for document level warning messages; within the “*yellow*” panel.  This message should highlight the items that weren’t updated using the text “* < 1 > # < 2 > not updated. The specified change conflicts with one or more of the company info or accounting elements that are already present on < 3 >. *“ < 1 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “* Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ Items *“. < 2 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should only display the index number of that item and follow that with the word “* was *”. If there are multiple consecutive items in the list, the system use the pattern  [index number of the 1st item in the list] - [index number of the last item in the list]  and follow that with the word  “were“ . If there are multiple items in the list, but they’re not consecutive, the system should list the index numbers of all those items separated by commas, with the last item in that list being separated by an “* and *”. The end of the list should be followed by the word  “were“ .  < 3 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “* this Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ these Items *“.

issues.description: We need to support this status transition of the catalogs from the following POST end point  https://api.vroozi.com/v1/catalogs/status-update From Working column (New/Updated) Rejected Approved From Approved Column Published (Live Column) to working column will move to Disapproved From Live Column Deactivate, When the catalog is active in live column (Offline) Activate, when the catalog is already deactivated in live column (Online) to Approved column will move the unpublished status Existing transitions from the UI should be followed in the same way as allowed from the smartOCI UI. Based on the DEV demo feedback, we need to update the implementation with the following changes 1- Need to use the URI status-update instead of actions 2- Need to record the incoming request into a separate collection, that will serve the purpose of doing the audit as well later. 3- Need to expose the requestId/processId field in the response, that will be used by the separate end point to track the progress of the async process.

issues.description: Note: This ticket  MUST ONLY  be release alongside    Business Case: Based on the changes made in   , the system’s logic for routing PR line items to the appropriate BuyerGroup needs to be updated.  Acceptance Criteria: Retain the current behavior where PR line items are auto-assigned to Buyer Groups based on matching attributes. Once assigned, PR line items should automatically appear in the "Ready for Sourcing" queue of all associated Buyers. Retain the current email notifications sent to Buyers when they receive a PR line item in their "Ready for Sourcing" queue. The fields that play a role in the routing logic include: Product Categories, Suppliers, Company Codes, Cost Centers, GL Codes, Projects, and Locations. If any of these fields are left blank on the Buyer Group definition, ignore those attributes when matching a PR line item to a Buyer Group. In case multiple Buyer Groups match a PR line item, show an error prompting the user to manually select a Buyer Group. Evaluate if this is possible: Log any routing failures and roll the entire PR document back to its previous state.

issues.summary: PMAN: Add additional parameters to the BuyerGroup definition
issues.description: Business Case: We need to provide unitID Admins with more granular control over which PR line items make it over to which BuyerGroups. In order to accomplish this, we need to add more parameters to the BuyerGroup definition.  Acceptance Criteria: Change this …  To this … General Changes from the existing modal: Remove the existing “ Click here to select all … “ links Move the existing “ Product Categories ” and “ Suppliers “ fields into their own section This section should be titled “ General Info ” Addition of new fields to the BuyerGroup definition: After the General section, add a new section called “ Company Info “ In this section, add a new type-ahead field for Company Codes After the Company Info section, add a new section called “ Accounting Info “ In this section, add new type-ahead fields for the following accounting objects: Cost Centers GL Codes Projects Locations General rules for the input fields: All the fields in the form, except for  Group Name  and  Group Description , should be optional If any of these fields are left empty, the effect should be the same as if the rule had been defined to work with any possible value for these fields.  All of the fields in the General Info, Company Info and Accounting Info sections should be type-ahead fields These fields need to be multi-select fields If the user clicks into the Company Codes field, they should see a list of all active, available master data objects for that specific field. If there’s no Company Code specified in the Buyer Group definition, when the user clicks into any of the Accounting Info fields, they should see a list of all active, available master data objects for that specific field. If there are one or more Company Codes specified in the Buyer Group definition, when the user clicks into any of the Accounting Info fields, they should see a list of all active, available master data objects for that specific field. However, these values should be filtered based on whether they’re linked to 1 of the specified Company Codes or not.  Clicking into any of these fields should  NOT  wipe out any of the previously selected values in that field.   Users should be able to manually remove individual selections from each of these fields by clicking on the “x” on that individual value’s “pill” If a selected value has been deactivated, or deleted from the unitID, the next time a user opens this modal, that value should be highlighted and the user should be informed of the change.  The following information was added on 12/01/2023 PKT: Help text to be used for each of the fields on this modal: Field Help Text New addition / Update to existing help text Associated Buyer(s) Please select the Buyers that you want to include in this group. If this Buyer Group is assigned to a line item, and the system evaluates that the line item should be routed into Vroozi BuyRoute, all the Buyers listed in this field will receive the item for sourcing.    Product Categories Please select the Product Categories you want to include in this group. This Buyer Group will be assigned to a line item, if the item is associated to one of the Product Categories selected in this field.    Suppliers Please select the Suppliers you want to include in this group. This Buyer Group will be assigned to a line item, if the item is associated to one of the Suppliers selected in this field.    Company Codes Please select the Company Codes you want to include in this group. This Buyer Group will be assigned to a line item, if the item is associated to one of the Company Codes selected in this field.   Cost Centers Please select the Cost Centers you want to include in this group. This Buyer Group will be assigned to a line item, if the item is associated to one of the Cost Centers selected in this field.    GL Codes Please select the GL Codes you want to include in this group. This Buyer Group will be assigned to a line item, if the item is associated to one of the GL Codes selected in this field.    Projects Please select the Projects you want to include in this group. This Buyer Group will be assigned to a line item, if the item is associated to one of the Projects selected in this field.    Locations Please select the Locations you want to include in this group. This Buyer Group will be assigned to a line item, if the item is associated to one of the Locations selected in this field.    The following information was updated on 12/21/2023 PKT: # Question Answer 1 Which fields should be shown on this modal? Only those fields should be visible on this UI, which the unitID is configured to use. 2 if an accounting object is enabled in the unitID, but configured as “Hidden” in the line item configs, should the Admin be able to define a Buyer Group based on that accounting object?  Except for the GL Codes, the answer would be yes. As these accounting objects can be configured in each requester’s user profile, even if the relevant fields are hidden on the UI at run-time.  3 Should the BuyerGroup definition apply any filtering logic when allowing an Admin to specify values in the fields?  Yes. But only if the BuyerGroup definition includes 1 or more Company Codes. If it does, then all child fields should present values filtered by the specified company codes. E.g. Each Cost Center in the list of options that the Admin can pick from, should be linked to at least 1 of the Company Codes that have been specified.  4 Should the BuyerGroup be updated on line items when a user updates the company info, or accounting info on that line item via the “Apply to All” function?  Yes. When the company info, or accounting info on a line item is updated via the “Apply to All” function, the system should evaluate whether the existing BuyerGroup assignment can work with the new information or not. If it can, then the existing assignment should be left as it is. If it can’t, then the system should fetch a new BuyerGroup based on the new information available on the line item.  5 Related to the question above, what should happen in the case of split-accounting being applied to the line item?  If the line item has split accounting applied to it, then the system should base the BuyerGroup assignment on the 1st split segment in the line item’s accounting info section.  6 What should happen if there are multiple BuyerGroups applicable to the line item?  Since the Buyer Group field is optional on the line item modal, we will leave that as it is. So …  - If the BE doesn’t return any Buyer Groups, leave this field empty - If the BE returns 1 Buyer Group, auto-select that value in this field - If the BE returns >1 Buyer Groups, auto-select the 1st value from that list in this field
